findings.title: Potentially unlimited indemnification
findings.rationale: Indemnity obligations may be uncapped, which can expose you to costs far beyond the contract value.

findings.title: Confidentiality may be perpetual / indefinite
findings.rationale: Indefinite confidentiality can create long-term compliance burden and uncertainty around retention and disclosure.
findings.matched_excerpt: ...7. CONFIDENTIALITY Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and survive termination without time limitation....
findings.context:
Notwithstanding the limitation of liability clause, Provider's liability for indemnification is unlimited.

6. TERM AND TERMINATION
Either party may terminate for convenience with 30 days written notice.

7. CONFIDENTIALITY
Confidentiality obligations are perpetual and survive termination without time limitation.

8. WARRANTIES

findings.rationale: Short or strict notice windows can lead to accidental renewals or unintended termination.

findings.rationale: Penalty terms can increase costs if payment timing slips.

1. SERVICES
Provider agrees to provide the services described in attached Statements of Work.

2. PAYMENT TERMS
Client shall pay Provider monthly in advance based on the service schedule. Late payments incur interest at 2% per month.

3. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
All work product and deliverables created by Provider under this Agreement shall be the exclusive property of Client. Provider assigns all rights to Client.
